APPLICANT NAME: ST. LOUIS AGENCY ON TRAINING AND EMPLOYMENT (SLATE)PROJECT TITLE: ST. LOUIS YOUTHBUILD PROGRAM FUNDING LEVEL REQUESTED:  1,500,000PROJECT SUMMARY AND INTENDED USE OF FUNDS: THE PROPOSED URBAN ST. LOUIS YOUTHBUILD PROJECT SERVES 65 YOUTH AGES 16 - 24 WITH TRAINING IN THE CONSTRUCTION TRADES AND TWO ADDITIONAL CONSTRUCTION PLUS FIELDS IN HEALTHCARE (CNA) AND LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION (CDL-A). SLATE AND ITS PARTNERS WILL RECRUIT ELIGIBLE YOUTH FROM AREAS OF HIGH POVERTY AND HIGH YOUTH UNEMPLOYMENT WITHIN THE ST. LOUIS METRO AREA. PARTICIPATION IN STL-YB INCLUDES: BASIC SKILLS DEVELOPMENT TO EARN A HIGH SCHOOL DIPLOMA OR ITS EQUIVALENT AND DEVELOP THE READING, MATH, AND LANGUAGE SKILLS NEEDED FOR EACH PARTICIPANTS CHOSEN CAREER FIELD  CONSTRUCTION AND CONSTRUCTION PLUS SKILLS TRAINING THROUGH BOTH CLASSROOM TRAINING AND HANDS-ON EXPERIENCE  AND LIFE SKILLS AND SOFT SKILLS DEVELOPMENT CONSISTING OF TRAINING IN LEADERSHIP, FINANCIAL LITERACY, AND WORKPLACE SURVIVAL SKILLS REINFORCED THROUGH WORK EXPERIENCES AND MENTORING. UPON COMPLETION, STL-YB WILL ASSIST PARTICIPANTS WITH PURSUING FURTHER TRAINING, PLACEMENT IN POST-SECONDARY EDUCATION, OR IN GAINING FULL-TIME EMPLOYMENT, WHILE CONTINUING TO PROVIDE SUPPORT DURING THE 12-MONTH FOLLOW-UP PERIOD. THE COST-PER-PARTICIPANT IS  23,000 (NOT INCLUDING MATCH FUNDING). DELIVERABLES OUTCOMES: STL-YB ANTICIPATES THAT 65 YOUTH AGES 16-24 WILL COMPLETE THE PROGRAM, WITH (AT LEAST) 75  PLACEMENT IN EDUCATION EMPLOYMENT IN THE 2ND QUARTER AFTER EXIT, 70  ATTAINING A CREDENTIAL, 80  EXPERIENCING MEASURABLE SKILL GAINS, AND 60  RETAINING EMPLOYMENT IN THE 4TH QUARTER AFTER EXIT.COST SHARING   MATCHING FUNDS AMOUNT: AS DESCRIBED IN THE BUDGET MATCH NARRATIVE, ST. LOUIS DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION, THE CITY OF ST. LOUIS, AND RANKEN TECHNICAL COLLEGE HAVE COMMITTED A TOTAL OF  375,000 IN LEVERAGED FUNDING. IN ADDITION, RANKEN COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION WILL PROVIDE AN IN-KIND CONTRIBUTION OF THE FULL COST OF CONSTRUCTION ON TWO (2) NEW HOMES WITH AN EXPECTED TOTAL COST PER UNIT OF  212,000, TOTALING  424,000 OF IN-KIND SUPPORT FOR THE PROJECT.DESCRIPTION OF THE AREA TO BE SERVED, INCLUDING ZIP CODES: THE PROPOSED SERVICE AREA FOR THE ST. LOUIS YOUTHBUILD PROGRAM INCLUDES 26 ZIP CODES LOCATED BOTH IN THE CITY OF ST. LOUIS AND CONTIGUOUS ZIP CODES IN ST. LOUIS COUNTY WITH HIGH RATES OF POVERTY AND YOUTH UNEMPLOYMENT. ZIP CODES WITHIN THE PROPOSED SERVICE AREA INCLUDE: 63101, 63102, 63103, 63104, 63106, 63107, 63108, 63109, 63110, 63111, 63112, 63115, 63116, 63118, 63139, 63147, 63117, 63120, 63123, 63125, 63130, 63133, 63136, 63137, 63138, AND 63143.EXPERIENCE WITH SECTION 3 OF THE HUD ACT OF 1968 (12 U.S. C. 1701U): IN 2015, SLATE PARTNERED WITH THE ST. LOUIS HOUSING AUTHORITY (SLHA) ON A HUD JOBS PLUS PILOT PROGRAM. TOGETHER, THE TWO ORGANIZATIONS CREATED EMPLOYMENT PATHWAYS, A CULTURE OF HOPE, AND AN INTERACTIVE COMMUNITY TECHNOLOGY LEARNING CENTER AT THE CLINTON-PEABODY DEVELOPMENT WITH 347 HOUSEHOLDS, MANY CONSISTING OF SINGLE MOTHERS, AND AN AVERAGE ANNUAL INCOME WELL BELOW THE AVERAGE FOR SIMILAR DEVELOPMENTS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: SLATE ANTICIPATES SUBCONTRACTS TO 1) RANKEN TECHNICAL COLLEGE AS THE PROVIDER OF CONSTRUCTION TRAINING CREDENTIALS  2) EDUCATIONAL DATA SYSTEMS, INC (EDSI) FOR STAFFING OF THE YOUNG ADULT DIVISION MANAGER, PROGRAM COORDINATOR, CASE MANAGEMENT, EDUCATION MENTOR JOB DEVELOPER , AND PROJECT ACCOUNTANT  3) THE DARUBY SCHOOL AS PROVIDER OF CNA TRAINING CREDENTIALS. 4) MTC TRUCK DRIVER TRAINING AS PROVIDER OF CDL-A TRAINING CREDENTIALS.PRIORITY CONSIDERATION - SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS: ALL HOMES BUILT OR REHABBED DURING THE STL-YB PROGRAM WILL BE ENERGY STAR COMPLIANT, WITH THE ADDED ADVANTAGE OF LEARNING INCREASINGLY IMPORTANT ENERGY-EFFICIENT CONSTRUCTION PRINCIPLES.

APPLICATION IS BEING SUBMITTED AS (CHECK ALL THAT APPLY): URBANDESCRIPTION OF THE AREA TO BE SERVED: PORTSMOUTH, VA.TARGET COMMUNITY SERVICE AREA, IDENTIFIED BY ZIP CODE(S): 23704APPLICANT IS A GOVERNMENT ENTITY IN A TERRITORY THAT IS ELIGIBLE FOR THE MATCHING WAIVER AND INTENDS TO WAIVE MATCH, AS DESCRIBED IN SECTION III.B.: NOAPPLYING FOR CONSTRUCTION PLUS: YESPROJECT DESCRIPTION: PORTSMOUTH REDEVELOPMENT HOUSING AUTHORITY REQUESTS  700,000 TO ADMINISTER YOUTHBUILD PROGRAM IN PORTSMOUTH, VA. THE PROGRAM WILL TARGET 30 YOUTH BETWEEN THE AGES OF 16 AND 24 WHO MEET THE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS: HIGH SCHOOL DROPOUTS, ADJUDICATED YOUTH, YOUTH AGING OUT OF FOSTER CARE, YOUTH WITH DISABILITIES, HOMELESS YOUTH, AND OTHER AT-RISK OR HIGH-RISK YOUTH POPULATIONS.PROPOSED TRAINING: OUR YOUTHBUILD PROGRAM EMPHASIZES BASIC EDUCATION (GED ATTAINMENT), VOCATIONAL TRAINING, HANDS-ON TRAINING, AND EMPLOYMENT, ALONG WITH CASE MANAGEMENT, MENTORING, AND SUPPORTIVE SERVICES, TO PREPARE YOUTH TO EXCEL IN TODAYS MODERN WORKPLACE. PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS WILL COMPLETE THE HANDS-ON SKILLS CONSTRUCTION TRAINING COMPONENT BY SUBSTANTIALLY RENOVATING A UNIT OF HOUSING FOR LOW-INCOME RESIDENTS. BECAUSE THE CONSTRUCTION PLUS PROGRAM IS INCLUDED AS PART OF OUR YOUTHBUILD PROGRAM, INDIVIDUALS WITH NON-CONSTRUCTION CAREER INTERESTS WILL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO RECEIVE TRAINING AND EARN INDUSTRY-RECOGNIZED CREDENTIALS IN HIGH-GROWTH AND INDUSTRY CLUSTER OCCUPATIONS. THE LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT TRAINING AND COMMUNITY SERVICE-LEARNING PROJECTS WILL ENHANCE THE YOUTHS LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT SKILLS AND INCREASE THEIR INVOLVEMENT IN COMMUNITY PROJECTS. IN THE COMMUNITY SERVICE-LEARNING PROJECTS, PARTICIPANTS WILL UTILIZE THE HANDS-ON CONSTRUCTION SKILLS ACQUIRED IN THE YOUTHBUILD PROGRAM.EACH PARTICIPANT WILL RECEIVE AN INDIVIDUALIZED ACTION PLAN CONSISTING OF WORK EXPERIENCE, MENTORING, JOB SHADOWING, AND INTERNSHIPS. UPON SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETING THE YOUTHBUILD PROGRAM, PARTICIPANTS CAN ENTER THE WORKFORCE EARNING A SELF-SUSTAINING WAGE OR FOLLOW A POST-SECONDARY EDUCATION PLAN.PROJECT GOALS:1. 73  OF YOUTH PLACED IN EDUCATION AND EMPLOYMENT IN THE 2ND QUARTER POST-EXIT.2. 78  OF THOSE PLACED REMAINING EMPLOYED OR ENROLLED IN THE 4TH QUARTER POST-EXIT.3. MEDIAN EARNINGS OF  2,100 PER MONTH IN THE 2ND QUARTER POST-EXIT.4. 76  OF PARTICIPANTS WILL EARN A CREDENTIAL5. 81  OF PARTICIPANTS WILL HAVE A MEASURABLE SKILL GAIN.6. WE EXPECT TO SERVE 4 EMPLOYERS.

PARTICIPANTS RECEIVE NCCER CLASSROOM INSTRUCTION IN BASIC CONSTRUCTION SKILLS, CARPENTRY, CONCRETE, ELECTRICAL, HVAC R, AND PLUMBING.PARTICIPANTS WILL RECEIVE THEIR HANDS-ON EXPERIENCE BY CONSTRUCTING A DUPLEX. ABSTRACT - MOTT COMMUNITY COLLEGE YOUTHBUILD PROGRAMMOTT COMMUNITY COLLEGE (MCC) REQUESTS  1,499,864.60 TO SERVE 68 YOUTH AGED 18-24 THROUGH THE MOTT COMMUNITY COLLEGE YOUTHBUILD (MCCYB) PROGRAM. MCC WILL MATCH THE  1,499,864.60 REQUEST WITH  524,255.00 IN FUNDING. THIS IS A CATEGORY B CONSTRUCTION PLUS URBAN APPLICATION WITH A TARGETED SERVICE AREA IN FLINT, MICHIGAN, SPECIFICALLY ZIP CODES 48503, 48504, 48505, 48506, AND 48507. THE TARGET ZIP CODES IN THE CITY OF FLINT COMPRISE 16 CENSUS TRACTS, OF WHICH 14 ARE DESIGNATED QUALIFIED OPPORTUNITY ZONES, LOW-INCOME COMMUNITIES, AND HAVE A WEIGHTED POVERTY AND UNEMPLOYMENT RATE OF 19.5 AND 18.0 PERCENTAGE POINTS HIGHER THAN THE NATIONAL RATE. FUNDING WILL SUPPORT THE MCCYB INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICE DELIVERY, INCLUDING 6.0 PROGRAM FTES. THE TOTAL COST PER PARTICIPANT WILL BE  22,059.MCC IS A POST-SECONDARY INSTITUTION COMMUNITY COLLEGE. AS FLINT S TITLE II ADULT EDUCATION AND LITERACY PROVIDER FOR 16 YEARS AND THE JOBS FOR MICHIGANS GRADUATES (JMG) OUT-OF-SCHOOL SERVICE PROVIDER FOR THE LOCAL WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT BOARD, MCC IS WELL-POSITIONED TO DELIVER PROGRAM SERVICES DIRECTLY. UPON AWARD, 51 YOUTHS WILL BE ENROLLED IN CONSTRUCTION TRAINING AND 17 IN CERTIFIED NURSING ASSISTANT (CNA). MCCYB WILL PROVIDE RIGOROUS EDUCATIONAL ATTAINMENT, HIGH-DEMAND OCCUPATIONAL CONSTRUCTION AND HEALTHCARE TRAINING, AND CAREER-FOCUSED PLACEMENT TO YOUTH WITH THE SUPPORT OF COMMUNITY PARTNERS AND EMPLOYERS. THE MCCYB PROGRAM HAS SIX CORE COMPONENTS: EDUCATION: PROVIDING LEARNER-CENTERED INDIVIDUALIZED CURRICULA BY CERTIFIED TEACHERS LEADING TO THE ATTAINMENT OF A HIGH SCHOOL DIPLOMA OR GED  CONSTRUCTION TRAINING: PROVIDING BUILDING CONSTRUCTION CERTIFICATION, INVOLVING HANDS-ON TRAINING FOR THE SUBSTANTIAL RENOVATION OF A HOME TO SERVE AS PERMANENT HOUSING FOR HOMELESS AND OR LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES IN FLINT  CERTIFIED NURSING ASSISTANT: PROVIDING TRAINING THAT RESULTS IN PORTABLE CREDENTIALS AND EMPLOYMENT WITH AN OPPORTUNITY OF POTENTIAL APPRENTICESHIP  CASE MANAGEMENT: PROVIDING CAREER AND EDUCATION SUPPORT, INCLUDING ADVISING AND REFERRAL FOR PARTICIPANTS FOR CO-ENROLLMENT INTO WIOA  LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT: PROVIDING LEADERSHIP TRAINING AND OPPORTUNITIES TO PRACTICE LEADERSHIP ELEMENTS, INCLUDING COMMUNITY SERVICE  TRANSITION SERVICES: PROVIDE EMPLOYMENT AND POST-SECONDARY PLACEMENT ASSISTANCE AND 12-MONTH FOLLOW-UP WITH SUPPORT SERVICES.YOUTH WILL PARTICIPATE IN A 26-WEEK CURRICULUM, INCLUDING 13 HOURS OF ACADEMIC INSTRUCTION, 12 HOURS OF OCCUPATIONAL SKILLS TRAINING, AND THREE HOURS OF LEADERSHIP PER WEEK. UPON PROGRAM COMPLETION, 82  OF YOUTH WILL BE PLACED IN EDUCATION, EMPLOYMENT, OR APPRENTICESHIP, RECEIVE A CREDENTIAL, AND DEMONSTRATE LITERACY NUMERACY GAINS. MOTT REQUESTS PRIORITY CONSIDERATION FOR SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS AS CONSTRUCTION TRAINING WILL INCLUDE A 30-HOUR GREEN CONSTRUCTION COURSE TEACHING THE KEY METHODS AND TECHNIQUES TO REDUCE THE OVERALL ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT AND AN OVERVIEW OF THE ENERGY STAR PROGRAM.MOTT COMMUNITY COLLEGE IS COMMITTED TO ESTABLISHING A SUCCESSFUL YOUTHBUILD PROGRAM. THE COLLEGE HAS IDENTIFIED AN EXTENSIVE NETWORK THROUGH SIGNED LETTERS OF COMMITMENT TO FACILITATING THE ACHIEVEMENT OF PROGRAM GOALS. FURTHERMORE, MOTT COMMUNITY COLLEGE WILL LEVERAGE  524,255 IN RESOURCES TO ENSURE PARTICIPANT SUCCESS AND POSITIVELY IMPACT THE FLINT COMMUNITY.

OUR NINE SCHOOL COMMUNITIES ARE IN HIGHLY REMOTE AND ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED AREAS  ONLY ONE OF OUR SCHOOLS IS ACCESSIBLE BY DIRT ROAD, AND SMALL AIRCRAFT REACH THE REST AT A HIGH COST. (99720, 99745, 99745, 99765, 99748, 99754, 99758, 99768, 99767, 99701). TO PROVIDE SERVICES FOR PARTICIPANTS IN THE INTERIOR OF ALASKA CAN BE EXPENSIVE. PROJECT SUMMARY: THE YOUTHBUILD PROGRAM LOCATED AT OGDEN-WEBER TECHNICAL COLLEGE (OTECH YB) WILL PROVIDE EDUCATION, SKILLS TRAINING, LEADERSHIP, CAREER EXPLORATION, COMMUNITY SERVICE OPPORTUNITIES, AND POST-PROGRAM SUPPORT TO OPPORTUNITY YOUTH RESIDING IN OGDEN, UTAH.INTENDED USE OF FUNDS: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO PROVIDE PERSONNEL, TRAVEL, EQUIPMENT, SUPPLIES, WRAPAROUND SERVICES, TRAINING, CONSTRUCTION MATERIALS FOR A NET ZERO HOME, EDUCATIONAL RESOURCES, SCHOLARSHIPS, AND PARTICIPANT STIPENDS TO ENSURE THE SUCCESS OF THE OTECH YB PROGRAM.PROJECT SCOPE: THE PROGRAM WILL SERVE A MINIMUM OF 84 YOUTH, AGES 16-24, RESIDING IN OGDEN CITY ZIP CODES 84401 AND 84404. FOLLOWING YOUTHBUILDS 50-40-10 MODEL, PROGRAM TIME WILL BE DEDICATED TO EDUCATION, CONSTRUCTION OCCUPATIONAL SKILLS TRAINING, LEADERSHIP, CAREER EXPLORATION AND PLANNING, COMMUNITY SERVICE LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES, AND 12-MONTH POST-PROGRAM SUPPORT. STUDENTS WILL BE OFFERED A NURSING ASSISTANT (NA) PROGRAM TRACK AS PART OF A CONSTRUCTION PLUS INITIATIVE. THE PROGRAM IS DESIGNED FOR A 30-HOUR WEEK: ACADEMICS FOR 15 HOURS (50 ), CONSTRUCTION TECHNOLOGY NA FOR 12 HOURS (40 ), AND LEADERSHIP TRAINING FOR 3 HOURS (10 ). SKILLS WILL BE INTEGRATED THROUGH PROJECT-BASED, PROBLEM-BASED LEARNING WHILE CONSTRUCTING A NET ZERO, ENERGY EFFICIENT, SINGLE-FAMILY HOME FOR A LOW-INCOME FAMILY WITH WEBER HOUSING AUTHORITY. STAFF MEMBERS BUILD A CULTURE OF RETENTION THROUGH PRE-ENROLLMENT CONTACT, TRANSITION SERVICES WITHIN THE FIRST MONTH, AND INDIVIDUALIZED DEVELOPMENT PLANS. A TRANSITION ASSESSMENT HELPS DETERMINE THE BEST PLACEMENT PATHWAY, E.G., EMPLOYMENT, FURTHER POSTSECONDARY EDUCATION, OR MILITARY SERVICE. STAFF INCLUDES A YOUTHBUILD PROJECT DIRECTOR, CONSTRUCTION TRAINER, INSTRUCTORS,CASE MANAGER, JOB DEVELOPER PLACEMENT SPECIALIST, SUCCESS COACH, AND TEACHERS AIDE, ALONG WITH EXISTING COLLEGE ADMINISTRATION, STAFF, AND FACULTY. THE OTECH CONSTRUCTION OCCUPATIONAL ADVISORY COMMITTEE, COMPRISING LOCAL INDUSTRY EMPLOYERS, PROVIDES ADVICE, EVALUATION, AND CRITICAL JOB PLACEMENT ASSISTANCE FOR PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS. OVER 35 COMMUNITY PARTNERS SUPPORT THE OTECH YB PROGRAM, ASSISTING WITH RECRUITMENT AND RESOURCE ACCESS FOR PARTICIPANTS.PROPOSED OUTCOMES: THE PROGRAM WILL CONTINUE TO MEET OR EXCEED YOUTHBUILD USA PERFORMANCE STANDARDS. ALL PARTICIPANTS WILL BE TESTED UPON ENTRY TO DETERMINE INDIVIDUAL GRADE LEVELS FOR READING AND MATH. THROUGH RIGOROUS ACADEMICS, PARTICIPANTS WILL EARN A HIGH SCHOOL DIPLOMA OR GED BASED ON THE 2014 GED PASSING STANDARDS. YOUTH WILL BE DUAL-ENROLLED IN POSTSECONDARY EDUCATION, EARNING AN INDUSTRY-RECOGNIZED 570-HOUR YB CONSTRUCTION TECHNOLOGY DIPLOMA OR A 285-HOUR NURSING ASSISTANT CERTIFICATE. PARTICIPANTS COMPLETE AN OSHA 10-HOUR SAFETY CERTIFICATE, ALONG WITH PORTABLE, STACKABLE CONSTRUCTION CORE CREDENTIALS FROM THE NATIONAL CENTER FOR CONSTRUCTION EDUCATION AND RESEARCH (NCCER), WHICH INCLUDE SAFETY, WORKPLACE LITERACY AND READINESS, CONSTRUCTION MATH, LEADERSHIP SKILLS, AND GREEN CONSTRUCTION. YOUTHBUILD GRADUATES ALSO HAVE ACCESS TO OVER 30 OTECH TECHNICAL CERTIFICATE PROGRAMS, ALL WIOA ELIGIBLE. OTECH IS ACCREDITED NATIONALLY BY THE COUNCIL ON OCCUPATION EDUCATION (COE) AND IS THE LARGEST PROVIDER OF APPRENTICE TRAINING IN THE STATE. THE UTAH DEPARTMENT OF WORKFORCE SERVICES HAS IDENTIFIED CONSTRUCTION WORKERS, ELECTRICIANS, CARPENTERS, AND NURSING ASSISTANTS AS HAVING MODERATE-SIGNIFICANT EMPLOYMENT GROWTH THROUGH 2022CREATING MORE THAN 1,900 POSITIONS ANNUALLY IN NORTHERN UTAH.
